trans-unit.source: purestemmer has only been tested on Python 2.7
trans-unit.target: purestemmer has only been tested on Python 2.7

trans-unit.source: purestemmer is on average about 100x slower than pystemmer
trans-unit.target: purestemmer is on average about 100x slower than pystemmer

trans-unit.source: purestemmer itself is covered by the MIT License. The underlying Snowball algorithms are covered by the BSD-3 License. Please see the
trans-unit.target: purestemmer itself is covered by the MIT License. The underlying Snowball algorithms are covered by the BSD-3 License. Please see the

trans-unit.source: Please see the pystemmer documentation for details on how to use the stemming algorithms.
trans-unit.target: Please see the pystemmer documentation for details on how to use the stemming algorithms.

trans-unit.source: Pure-Python implementations of the Snowball stemmers
trans-unit.target: Pure-Python implementations of the Snowball stemmers

trans-unit.source: Since purestemmer has the same public API and provides the same algorithms as pystemmer, there should be no need to change any code when switching between pystemmer and purestemmer like this.
trans-unit.target: Since purestemmer has the same public API and provides the same algorithms as pystemmer, there should be no need to change any code when switching between pystemmer and purestemmer like this.

trans-unit.source: The implementations of the stemming algorithms is translated from the Snowball language to Python via sbl2py.
trans-unit.target: The implementations of the stemming algorithms is translated from the Snowball language to Python via sbl2py.

trans-unit.source: The traditional way of using the Snowball stemmers in Python is via the pystemmer package, which provides a Python wrapper around the Snowball C library. However, Python C extensions are problematic in some environments. Therefore, this package provides pure-Python implementations of the Snowball stemming algorithms.
trans-unit.target: The traditional way of using the Snowball stemmers in Python is via the pystemmer package, which provides a Python wrapper around the Snowball C library. However, Python C extensions are problematic in some environments. Therefore, this package provides pure-Python implementations of the Snowball stemming algorithms.

trans-unit.source: Usually, you’ll prefer to use the pystemmer module whenever that is possible, because it’s much faster than purestemmer:
trans-unit.target: Usually, you’ll prefer to use the pystemmer module whenever that is possible, because it’s much faster than purestemmer:
